title: weekly.2012-02-14  src/all.{bash|bat} failed on Windows
body:
weekly.2012-02-07 was building fine.

Please provide any additional information below.

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly
$ ls
AUTHORS       PATENTS        bin          gocode   misc        src
CONTRIBUTORS  README         doc          include  pkg         test
LICENSE       VERSION.cache  favicon.ico  lib      robots.txt

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly
$ hg id
52ba9506bd99 weekly/weekly.2012-02-07

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly
$ hg pull
pulling from https://go.googlecode.com/hg/
searching for changes
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 152 changesets with 508 changes to 356 files
(run 'hg update' to get a working copy)

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly
$ hg update weekly
452 files updated, 0 files merged, 12 files removed, 0 files unresolved

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly
$ ls
AUTHORS       PATENTS        bin          gocode   misc        src
CONTRIBUTORS  README         doc          include  pkg         test
LICENSE       VERSION.cache  favicon.ico  lib      robots.txt

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly
$ cd src/

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly/src
$ ls
Make.dist  clean.bash  lib9     make.bash  quietgcc  sudo.bash
all.bash   cmd         libbio   make.bat   run.bash  xymon.exe
all.bat    gomake      libmach  pkg        run.bat

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly/src
$ ./all.bash
ERROR: Do not use make.bash to build on Windows.
Use make.bat instead.


goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly/src
$ ./all.bat
./all.bat: line 1: ::: command not found
./all.bat: line 2: ::: command not found
./all.bat: line 3: ::: command not found
./all.bat: line 4: @echo: command not found
./all.bat: line 23: syntax error: unexpected end of file

goweekly@gobuild /c/goweekly/src
$
